feed.title: Mailu Releases
feed.subtitle: Self-hosted software releases generated by selfh.st

entry.title: New release for Mailu: 2024.06.22
entry.content:
Changelog :mailbox:

  • HTTP/2 does not require ipv6; in fact it does not require SSL certs either

  • This release was triggered by PR/Issue 3613.

  • The release notes of the original main release can be accessed via menu item 'Release notes' on mailu.io.

Update

The main version X.Y (e.g. 1.9) will always reflect the latest version of the branch. To update your Mailu installation simply pull the latest images `docker compose pull && docker compose up -d`.

The pinned version X.Y.Z (e.g. 1.9.1) is not updated. It is pinned to the commit that was used for creating this release. You can use a pinned version to make sure your Mailu installation is not suddenly updated when recreating containers. The pinned version allows the user to manually update. It also allows to go back to a previous pinned version.

entry.title: New release for Mailu: 2024.06.23
entry.content:
Changelog :mailbox:

  • Filter logs line based and in binary mode without decoding utf-8

  • This release was triggered by PR/Issue 3618.

  • The release notes of the original main release can be accessed via menu item 'Release notes' on mailu.io.

entry.title: New release for Mailu: 2024.06.25
entry.content:
Changelog :mailbox:

  • Upgrade snappymail to v2.38.2 ; this is a security fix for GHSA-2rq7-79vp-ffxm (mXSS)

  • This release was triggered by PR/Issue 3648.

  • The release notes of the original main release can be accessed via menu item 'Release notes' on mailu.io.

Update

The main version X.Y (e.g. 1.9) will always reflect the latest version of the branch. To update your Mailu installation simply pull the latest images `docker compose pull && docker compose up -d`.

The pinned version X.Y.Z (e.g. 1.9.1) is not updated. It is pinned to the commit that was used for creating this release. You can use a pinned version to make sure your Mailu installation is not suddenly updated when recreating containers. The pinned version allows the user to manually update. It also allows to go back to a previous pinned version.

entry.title: New release for Mailu: 2024.06.26
entry.content:
Changelog :mailbox:

  • Don't check empty passwords against HIBP

  • This release was triggered by PR/Issue 3650.

  • The release notes of the original main release can be accessed via menu item 'Release notes' on mailu.io.

You can use a pinned version to make sure your Mailu installation is not suddenly updated when recreating containers. The pinned version allows the user to manually update.
